text: today I'm going to show you how to cut
up a whole chicken into pieces so that
you can use it for whatever kind of
cooking you want to do fried chicken
roast chicken chicken chicken you name
it chicken you can do it yourself so to
get started the first thing that you
want to do is cut between the leg and
the breast angling a little bit more
towards the legs so that you don't mess
up the skin on the breast this is
especially important if you're going to
cook your chicken with the skin on which
a lot of recipes call for then cut down
between the leg and the breast and then
pop the thigh bone out of the socket it
sounds kind of gross
but it's what you have to do and it
makes it really easy to just cut down
between the back of the chicken and the
thigh and it comes off right away
super easy you're not cutting through
bone or anything really do the same
thing on the second side
cut down through the skin sometimes I
turn this on the side a little bit just
to get down in there and then pop it out
of its socket I know it's terrible right
but it's the way it is want to do it
that's what it is and it's kind of fun a
little satisfying so cut between the
thigh bone and the body just cut
straight through there and then you have
your two leg thigh pieces the next thing
our remove is removing your wings and
you do it sort of in a similar way I
just like to pull back on the wing pull
it away from the body and then just cut
in and as you're cutting in it sort of
pops out of its socket on its own and
you cut straight through there same
thing on the other side put the chicken
on side to do this it makes it really
easy sometimes you have a little bit of
a hard time finding the exact spot just
keep working at it till you get there
then this is where I like to use my
kitchen shears and take the chicken and
I turn it on its neck end and I cut you
want to cut between the back and rib
bones and the and the breast the back
here is what you want to remove and the
breast is what you want to keep so cut
between those scissors works so well for
this you just have a little bit more
control than using a knife but you could
totally use a knife do the same thing on
the other side so that you're removing
the breast in one whole piece and the
backbone in one whole piece that you
want to save because you're going to
make stock that's one of the advantages
of cutting up your own chicken you get
something like this save it this is
actually the whole breast a lot of times
recipes will call for a breast
they usually mean a half a breast this
is a whole breast the one thing that's a
little bit hard to cut is right here
where the wishbone is so you take the
heel of your knife it's part of your
knife and just whack it might have to do
it a couple times to break through there
until it starts separating and then you
can go in with your knife once it's
through sort of crack it open this is
the wishbone right there cut through
that and then you no more bones no more
bones what I like to do with this one is
once I get through the meat I turn it
over and then cut through the skin with
some scissors that way just ensure that
the same amount of skin and top and each
side of the breast if you want the
chicken to cook evenly you can cut it
slightly on a diagonal so that the thick
part is in one piece and the thinner
part is in one piece and that really
helps with even cooking give it a little
whack if it's not working her simply way
to get your aggressions out have a hard
time just go back to your scissors this
is better to do from the skin side so
that you'd get a nice clean cut through
the skin same thing with the other one
again so that's the breast pieces it's
gonna put these away for a second just
to get them out of the way because I
need the board goes away save them for
later what do we have here
though wings sometimes you want to
remove the wingtips they burn sometimes
you don't some people love that part but
if you want to remove them just get a
whack down there nice it takes a couple
tries and then you have these little
wing tips you're not going to cook these
with the dish that you're working on
then add those to the back bones and
then lastly but not leastly
is separating the thigh and the
drumstick and there's a line of fat that
runs right between the thigh and the
drumstick and if you follow that line
with your knife you're going to cut
right between the joint and you're not
going to have a struggle at all it's
going to be super easy like buttah
except it's chicken do the same thing on
the other side and then you have your
chicken cut up into ten pieces and this
is perfect for a fried chicken for
instance which I'm going to make
tomorrow I'm going to show you how to
make it with lots of other dishes too
you can roast chicken pieces like this
you can do whatever you want and you did
it yourself so you should be really sad
here they all are your leg and thigh
pieces your two wings and then four

I mean it's as beautiful as red chicken
